result.execSummary:
The defendant Maurice A Shegonee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and compliance of all conditions of probation on 14CF61.

records.addlTxt: Letter from DF requesting bond mney to be refunded.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:17 PM. Also called 14CF97, 15CF73 and 15CF43. State - all matters resolved. Cveykus and Shegonee agree. Cveykus - 14CF61 - amend #1 to receiving stolen property (firearm) contrary to 943.34(1)(bm) (Class H felony), amend #2 to receiving stolen property to 943.34(1)(bm) with same penalties, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 14CF43 - g/nc to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 15CF73 - plead g/nc to count #2 and #3 as alleged, dismiss and read in remaining counts; 14CF97 - dismiss and read in entire file; 15CF43 - #1, #2 and #3 - joint of $300 fine plus costs on each count ($831.00 per count); 15CF73 - joint recommenadton of $300 fine plus costs on #2 ($705/$894) and $500 ($1158.00) fine plus costs on count #3 - ask for expungment at end of 2 years for stated reasons; 14CF61 - place on probation for 2 years on each count with conditions of: counseling as deemed appropriate, court costs on each count ($523.00/count), employment/school, $550.00 in restitution including VW surcharge, DA will be asking for jail time on that case with the probation being consecutive to jail time, bond forfeiture to be set aside and used for fines and costs. State has an issue regarding the request for expunction - only if probation is completed successfully. Cveykus - believes the defendant would be eligible for expunction for stated reasons (adjudication as a juvenile). Court responds. Shegonee agrees with resolution as stated by Cveykus. State agrees. Court - 14CF97 - dismissed and read in entirely; 14CF61 - amends count #1 and #2 to receiving stolen property (firearm) contrary to 943.34(1)(bm) - reads new charge and penalty, pleads G to amended counts #1 and #2, Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#3 and #4). 15CF73 - Shegonee pleads G to counts #2 and #3 as alleged, dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#1, #4 and #5). 15CF43 - Shegonee pleads G to counts #1, #2 and #3 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in remaining counts (#4 and #5). Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State - has complied with vicrtim notification requirements - makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asking for conditional jail time of 9 months and then 2 years probation on 14CF61, other conditions should include AODA, anger management, restitution, absolute sobriety, no posssesion of alcohol, no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, obtain HS diploma, community service, no contact with the victim in 14CF61. Cveykus makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow recommendation - asking that court not impose jail time for stated reasons - 82 days credit between all cases. Shegonee makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: will allow expungment upon successful completion of probation; 14CF61 - count #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on prbation for 3 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: can petititon for expungement upon successful completion of probation and full satisfaction of all conditions, AODA and follow thru, restitution of $550.00 including VW surcharge - transfer money from 15CF73 and take bond posted, submit DNA sample - given form in Court, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, obtain GED/HSED or equivalent, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service, no contact with the victims, not imposing jail, orders any bond forfeited to remain forfeited (14CF61 - forfeit, 14CF97 - forfeit, 15CF43 - forfeit), costs on each count - take bond posted; 15CF73 - counts #2 and #3 - fine of $1000.00 on each count plus costs and assessment; 15CF43 - counts #1, #2 and #3 - $500 fine plus costs and assessments on each count, grants expunction under 973.015 upon successful completion of probation and compliance of all conditions of probation, right to appeal, no possession firearms, no voting rights, submit DNA sample - given form in Court, refund any bond to poster ($10,000.00), 82 days credit if revoked.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Called at 3:03 PM. Also called 14CF97, 15CF43, 15CF61. State puts off record conversation on the record. Set all matters for JT with the hopes that they will all be resolved, continue bond, and #1 JT will be 15CF43 and 15CF73 for JT on 8/13/15 & 8/14/15. Cveykus and Shegonee agree and has gone over Frye with the defendant. Court adjourns bail bond forfeiture hearing to 8/13/15 as well. Instructed to contact court ASAP if matters are resolved as there are other JT's set for that day.  Jury trial scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Called 3:19 PM. Also called 15CF73, 14CF61 14CF97 15CF43. State - on 15CF43 & 15CF73 here for PH. In anticipation of a waiver, state has filed information on both cases (both mirror complaint) and the remaining cases here for bail/bond review. Cveykus has had discussions with client and are waiving right to PH. Shegonee agrees. Court goes over PH waiver form and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intellegintly waiving his right to a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause that a felony may have been committed and binds over for trial. Cveykus is willing to proceed today with ARGN and waives further reading of information filed, enters NG pleas on all counts on both cases. 14CF61 & 14CF97 - State has filed petition to forfeit bond. Cveykus - will be filing objection to forfeiture of bond. Cveykus had just mailed the Brief in Opposition earlier this week and matters will all be heard on July 22, 2015 at 2:30 pm, along with the Final pre-trial for both cases 15CF43 & 15CF73, scheduled for July 22, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:42 AM. Also called 15CF43, 14CF97, and 15CF73. State - here for AIA on 15CF73 and all other matters are set for STC. Cveykus agrees, has compaint in 15CF73, waives reading, requests PH but waives time limits. Court will consider time limits waived, set 15CF73 and 15CF43 for PH on 6/25/15 at 3:15 PM. Court continues bond on all matters and sets 14CF61 and 14CF97 for JT's on 8/13/15 and 8/14/15 with 14CF61 being #1 JT.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 03:15 pm.

Defendant Maurice A Shegonee in court and without counsel.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:57 AM. Shegonee indicates he has retained an attorney on other cases, but is not sure if he was aware of today's proceedings. Defendant has received complaint. Court reads charges, pentalties and rights. Defendant understands charges. Court advises of right to attorney but understands he has hired his own attorney. Bond continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 17, 2015 at 09:30 am.
